com.wingfoot.xml.schema
Interface SchemaReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
SchemaReaderInstance
public interface SchemaReader

Interface that defines the properties of a SchemaReader. A SchemaReader is used to parse a well formed XML schema and convert to an object (Java) representation. The object representation is an instance of SchemaHolder. All components of the xml schema (elements, attributes, groups etc) are accessible using the getter methods in SchemaHolder.

An implementation of SchemaReader is provided. This is the default reader. Users can create their own schema readers by implementing instance of this interface and providing a reference to the new class in SchemaReaderFactory class

Method Summary
 SchemaHolder parse(byte[] schemaPayload)
          Takes a byte array representing a well formed XML schema and returns back an instance of SchemaHolder that encapsulates the schema into Components.

Method Detail

parse

public SchemaHolder parse(byte[] schemaPayload)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Takes a byte array representing a well formed XML schema and returns back an instance of SchemaHolder that encapsulates the schema into Components. These Components can be accessed using the getter methods in the SchemaHolder interface.
Parameters:
schemaPayload - a byte representation of a well formed XML schema.
Returns:
SchemaHolder Object representation of the XML schema.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs; typically concrete implementations throw a subclass of the Exception class.

parse

public SchemaHolder parse(org.kxml.parser.XmlParser parser)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
